People are swayed by mob mentality. NJZ is definitely damaged. Nevertheless, they are being subjected to excessive personal attacks. The fandoms of other idols mentioned in this incident are expressing excessive anger. The BBC is only concerned about this. People say they are making legitimate criticisms, but in my opinion, the atmosphere here is full of malice.

@choomr3824Â  Why do you think this is just a fandom issue? This group targeted another group, and even mentioned that groupâ€™s manager in government and court statements â€” with insufficient evidence. In this situation, most Koreans are upset, because we can relate more to that manager's position.

@choomr3824Â  After that, the interview focused only on the girl group, without considering the victims of their actions. BBC Korea even deleted mentions of how many people were harmed and what damage was caused by this group.

@@lisahong1221 The court's decision should be accepted. However, the reason for the decision was that it was not recognized as a serious reason for contract termination, and it does not mean that the girls' experiences were false. These girls clearly suffered injustice, but it did not lead to contract termination. Sometimes, the law does not side with them unless sufficient evidence is proven, even if it is not false. We must not forget that these girls are fighting against the best conglomerate with a lot of infrastructure. And I think the other idols they mentioned were not targeted, but because they had to be specific when announcing this incident.

@choomr3824Â  Then, in a situation where something hasnâ€™t been fully proven and still needs to be discussed, would you also say itâ€™s okay to publicly name and criticize peopleâ€”like the Korean government, court, or journalistsâ€”just because it 'feels true' from your side? Real people are getting hurt from that kind of framing. Iâ€™m Korean, so please understand if my grammar sounds a bit awkward.

In the end, even after the trial, those girls did an interview asking the managerâ€”who has been going to therapyâ€”to make an official apology, despite still lacking solid proof.

What is happening with the BBC
channel regarding the deletion of comments in this video is a media scandal by all standards, and this channel should be boycotted and held accountable for what is happening. The act of silencing voices, suppressing freedoms, and denying freedom of speech has become the current approach of the BBC channel. 
The channel claims to respect freedom of speech, but in reality, it has deleted hundreds of comments criticizing the NewJeans group, and some of these comments had received thousands of likes and support. 
Are you trying to manipulate the truth and deceive public opinion?
Whether you agree with this or not, the entire public is shocked by the actions and reactions of the NewJeans group. Their objection to a court ruling, if it had happened in any other country, would be considered an act that threatens national security. What is happening with the BBC
channel regarding the deletion of comments in this video is a media scandal by all standards, and this channel should be boycotted and held accountable for what is happening. The act of silencing voices, suppressing freedoms, and denying freedom of speech has become the current approach of the BBC channel. 
The channel claims to respect freedom of speech, but in reality, it has deleted hundreds of comments criticizing the NewJeans group, and some of these comments had received thousands of likes and support. 
Are you trying to manipulate the truth and deceive public opinion?
Whether you agree with this or not, the entire public is shocked by the actions and reactions of the NewJeans group. Their objection to a court ruling, if it had happened in any other country, would be considered an act that threatens national security. They would have been imprisoned because the independence of the judiciary is something that cannot be publicly criticized or opposed, as this threatens the stability of national security in any country.
The NewJeans group is behaving and thinking in a way that makes us wonder if they need psychological treatment.
The NewJeans group is already finished, and this is what they donâ€™t believe, but the coming days will prove this. 
They will definitely lose the case, and anyone with a little bit of sense knows this. They will be ordered to pay millions of dollars in compensation. 
Not only will they lose the money they earned, but they will live their entire lives in debt, paying off their liabilities. Their popularity is already starting to fade.
Congratulations on destroying yourselves, destroying your professional careers, and destroying your future, all for nothing and for no reason. You will discover the truth about Min Hee Jin, but by the time you do, it will be too late.
To the commentators, I want you to know that most of your comments criticizing NewJeans have been hidden. However, they only appear to you and not to others. They do this so that you won't notice that your comments have been deleted. I have submitted official complaints to relevant authorities to investigate what happened with the deletion of comments on this video

WHY YOU HATE THE VICTIMS? 
It's a long and complex story, people.
"mistreatment" and "manipulation" refer to the management of the group. NewJeans had the potential 
to become the new Blackpink, but HYBE unfairly fired their genius mentor and CEO of ADOR (the 
label), MHJ. MHJ complained to HYBE because they used her artistic work to create ILLIT (the group of 
another label, BeLift, which NewJeans fans call BeThief) even copying parts of the choreography. 
HYBE instead of finding a smart solution and calming the waters, fired MHJ. From here began the war 
between MHJ and HYBE, which began with a press conference where MHJ denounces all the 
wrongdoings of HYBE and its founder Bang, the creator of BTS.
MHJ takes HYBE to court and the court rules in her favor, then she returns to ADOR and brings 
Newjeans to success in Japan. Then HYBE finds a way to take away her power and she finally gives in 
and resigns.
HYBE/ADOR 2.0 announces to the girls and their parents that they will be put on long-term 
retirement, that the music producers will be changed and ADOR also argues with the director of the 
group's fantastic MVs. "NewJeans" practically no longer exists.
At this point, the girls step in, demanding MHJ's return. From this moment on, the episodes of 
corporate ostracism and sabotage of the group begin, culminating in the girls' decision to leave the 
company (ADOR/HYBE).
HYBE killed "NewJeans", they also eliminated Dolphiners (MVs creator) and the original music 
producers (!) from future plans, so only the name of NewJeans remained. This is unacceptable.
In the meantime, CEO Park informed the girls and their parents that they would be put on leave for a 
year and a half. Practically a death sentence.
The girls are just trying to keep the artistic identity of NewJeans alive by transferring it to NJZ, 
opposing in every way possible the evil sabotage of HYBE.
Unfortunately this is the truth. Only if only MHJ had been eliminated and everything else kept intact, 
would HYBE have been credible.
These girls are the victims, but HYBE's mediaplay is deceiving everyone who doesn't know the story.

WHY YOU HATE THE VICTIMS? 
It's a long and complex story, people.
"mistreatment" and "manipulation" refer to the management of the group. NewJeans had the potential 
to become the new Blackpink, but HYBE unfairly fired their genius mentor and CEO of ADOR (the 
label), MHJ. MHJ complained to HYBE because they used her artistic work to create ILLIT (the group of 
another label, BeLift, which NewJeans fans call BeThief) even copying parts of the choreography. 
HYBE instead of finding a smart solution and calming the waters, fired MHJ. From here began the war 
between MHJ and HYBE, which began with a press conference where MHJ denounces all the 
wrongdoings of HYBE and its founder Bang, the creator of BTS.
MHJ takes HYBE to court and the court rules in her favor, then she returns to ADOR and brings 
Newjeans to success in Japan. Then HYBE finds a way to take away her power and she finally gives in 
and resigns.
HYBE/ADOR 2.0 announces to the girls and their parents that they will be put on long-term 
retirement, that the music producers will be changed and ADOR also argues with the director of the 
group's fantastic MVs. "NewJeans" practically no longer exists.
At this point, the girls step in, demanding MHJ's return. From this moment on, the episodes of 
corporate ostracism and sabotage of the group begin, culminating in the girls' decision to leave the 
company (ADOR/HYBE).
HYBE killed "NewJeans", they also eliminated Dolphiners (MVs creator) and the original music 
producers (!) from future plans, so only the name of NewJeans remained. This is unacceptable.
In the meantime, CEO Park informed the girls and their parents that they would be put on leave for a 
year and a half. Practically a death sentence.
The girls are just trying to keep the artistic identity of NewJeans alive by transferring it to NJZ, 
opposing in every way possible the evil sabotage of HYBE.
Unfortunately this is the truth. Only if only MHJ had been eliminated and everything else kept intact, 
would HYBE have been credible.
These girls are the victims, but HYBE's mediaplay is deceiving everyone who doesn't know the story.

@ njz received 5 billion because of their achievements. All idols receive huge investments. The amount may vary. However, not all idols who receive investments succeed as quickly as njz. This is because of their music and talent, and the music they released was not provided by HYBE. Do you think that because they received 5 billion, they can't say anything about unfair treatment? I don't think so. Rather, I think that if they have good achievements, they should be treated accordingly. njz never asked to terminate their contract with HYBE from the beginning. What these girls wanted was to continue doing what they had been doing for the past year. They never talked about money. Wasn't that a humble request from an artist who had earned 150 billion won in just one year since debut? But the answer to this question was rejected, and the members had to check it out on the news instead of hearing it for themselves. The trust in this contract started to crumble from that point on. Is this an unreasonable demand?

@choomr3824Â  they are in no position to request termination of their contract regardless of whether they like the company's system or not (unless they pay financial penalties), so I'm not sure why their fans keep bringing this up. So what exactly is it that they had been doing they want to continue? Working with Min HeeJin? Nowhere in the contract states that she's New Jean's permanent director and therefore, it is company's authority to determine whether to keep her or not. Of course, I understand how Min HeeJin kicked out bummed them out, but that alone is not a sufficient reason for breaking up their contract.

What is happening with the BBC
channel regarding the deletion of comments in this video is a media scandal by all standards, and this channel should be boycotted and held accountable for what is happening. The act of silencing voices, suppressing freedoms, and denying freedom of speech has become the current approach of the BBC channel. 
The channel claims to respect freedom of speech, but in reality, it has deleted hundreds of comments criticizing the NewJeans group, and some of these comments had received thousands of likes and support. 
Are you trying to manipulate the truth and deceive public opinion?
Whether you agree with this or not, the entire public is shocked by the actions and reactions of the NewJeans group. Their objection to a court ruling, if it had happened in any other country, would be considered an act that threatens national security. They would have been imprisoned because the independence of the judiciary is something that cannot be publicly criticized or opposed, as this threatens the stability of national security in any country.
The NewJeans group is behaving and thinking in a way that makes us wonder if they need psychological treatment.
The NewJeans group is already finished, and this is what they donâ€™t believe, but the coming days will prove this. 
They will definitely lose the case, and anyone with a little bit of sense knows this. They will be ordered to pay millions of dollars in compensation.

Congratulations on destroying yourselves, destroying your professional careers, and destroying your future, all for nothing and for no reason. You will discover the truth about Min Hee Jin, but by the time you do, it will be too late.
To the commentators, I want you to know that most of your comments criticizing NewJeans have been hidden. However, they only appear to you and not to others. WHY YOU HATE THE VICTIMS? 
It's a long and complex story, people.
"mistreatment" and "manipulation" refer to the management of the group. NewJeans had the potential 
to become the new Blackpink, but HYBE unfairly fired their genius mentor and CEO of ADOR (the 
label), MHJ. MHJ complained to HYBE because they used her artistic work to create ILLIT (the group of 
another label, BeLift, which NewJeans fans call BeThief) even copying parts of the choreography. 
HYBE instead of finding a smart solution and calming the waters, fired MHJ. From here began the war 
between MHJ and HYBE, which began with a press conference where MHJ denounces all the 
wrongdoings of HYBE and its founder Bang, the creator of BTS.
MHJ takes HYBE to court and the court rules in her favor, then she returns to ADOR and brings 
Newjeans to success in Japan. Then HYBE finds a way to take away her power and she finally gives in 
and resigns.
HYBE/ADOR 2.0 announces to the girls and their parents that they will be put on long-term 
retirement, that the music producers will be changed and ADOR also argues with the director of the 
group's fantastic MVs. "NewJeans" practically no longer exists.
At this point, the girls step in, demanding MHJ's return. From this moment on, the episodes of 
corporate ostracism and sabotage of the group begin, culminating in the girls' decision to leave the 
company (ADOR/HYBE).
HYBE killed "NewJeans", they also eliminated Dolphiners (MVs creator) and the original music 
producers (!) from future plans, so only the name of NewJeans remained. This is unacceptable.
In the meantime, CEO Park informed the girls and their parents that they would be put on leave for a 
year and a half. Practically a death sentence.

WHY YOU HATE THE VICTIMS? 
It's a long and complex story, people.
"mistreatment" and "manipulation" refer to the management of the group. NewJeans had the potential 
to become the new Blackpink, but HYBE unfairly fired their genius mentor and CEO of ADOR (the 
label), MHJ. MHJ complained to HYBE because they used her artistic work to create ILLIT (the group of 
another label, BeLift, which NewJeans fans call BeThief) even copying parts of the choreography. 
HYBE instead of finding a smart solution and calming the waters, fired MHJ. From here began the war 
between MHJ and HYBE, which began with a press conference where MHJ denounces all the 
wrongdoings of HYBE and its founder Bang, the creator of BTS.
MHJ takes HYBE to court and the court rules in her favor, then she returns to ADOR and brings 
Newjeans to success in Japan. Then HYBE finds a way to take away her power and she finally gives in 
and resigns.
HYBE/ADOR 2.0 announces to the girls and their parents that they will be put on long-term 
retirement, that the music producers will be changed and ADOR also argues with the director of the 
group's fantastic MVs. "NewJeans" practically no longer exists.
At this point, the girls step in, demanding MHJ's return. From this moment on, the episodes of 
corporate ostracism and sabotage of the group begin, culminating in the girls' decision to leave the 
company (ADOR/HYBE).
HYBE killed "NewJeans", they also eliminated Dolphiners (MVs creator) and the original music 
producers (!) from future plans, so only the name of NewJeans remained. This is unacceptable.
In the meantime, CEO Park informed the girls and their parents that they would be put on leave for a 
year and a half. Practically a death sentence.
The girls are just trying to keep the artistic identity of NewJeans alive by transferring it to NJZ, 
opposing in every way possible the evil sabotage of HYBE.
Unfortunately this is the truth. Only if only MHJ had been eliminated and everything else kept intact, 
would HYBE have been credible.
These girls are the victims, but HYBE's mediaplay is deceiving everyone who doesn't know the story.

It was supposed to be a labor-capital conflict. Iâ€™m sorry that some bunnies are being rude and stupid, it is just how people often areâ€¦ but to be honest I donâ€™t think members of illit or le sserafim are any better off in the company.
